verses.verse: To the chief Musician <S%H5329><s%> <S%H8764><s%>, A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%>. How long wilt thou forget <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me, O YY <S%H3068><s%>? for ever <S%H5331><s%>? how long wilt thou hide <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thy face <S%H6440><s%> from me?

How long shall I take <S%H7896><s%> <S%H8799><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> in my soul <S%H5315><s%>, having sorrow <S%H3015><s%> in my heart <S%H3824><s%> daily <S%H3119><s%>? how long shall mine enemy <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%> be exalted <S%H7311><s%> <S%H8799><s%> over me?

Consider <S%H5027><s%> <S%H8685><s%> and hear <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8798><s%> me, O YY <S%H3068><s%> my 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: lighten <S%H215><s%> <S%H8685><s%> mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>, lest I sleep <S%H3462><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the sleep of death <S%H4194><s%>;

Lest mine enemy <S%H341><s%> <S%H8802><s%> say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, I have prevailed <S%H3201><s%> <S%H8804><s%> against him; and those that trouble <S%H6862><s%> me rejoice <S%H1523><s%> <S%H8799><s%> when I am moved <S%H4131><s%> <S%H8735><s%>.
But I have trusted <S%H982><s%> <S%H8804><s%> in thy mercy <S%H2617><s%>; my heart <S%H3820><s%> shall rejoice <S%H1523><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in thy salvation <S%H3444><s%>.
I will sing <S%H7891><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto the YY <S%H3068><s%>, because he hath dealt bountifully <S%H1580><s%> <S%H8804><s%> with me.
